definition:
A chronic condition is a
human health condition or disease that is persistent or otherwise
long-lasting in its effects or a disease that comes with time. The
term chronic is often applied when the course of the disease lasts for
more than three months. Common chronic diseases include arthritis,
asthma, cancer, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, diabetes, Lyme
disease, autoimmune diseases, genetic disorders and some viral
diseases such as hepatitis C and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome.
[from Wikipedia]
